item.title: Linux Memory Alert Caused By Slab
item.description: Note: English is not my primary language. If you find the content confusing, you can email me for explanation. buff/cache of free is not same as Buffer + Cached from /proc/meminfo. And the way we used to measure memory acutal usage percent is problematic. Background Recently I encountered a colleague’s feedback: ‘Memory usage percent greater than 90%’ are reported by an alert, but we find that the actual usage is only 50%.
